Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • Game

  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the Game in which there are two Characters trying to find each other in a maze, while walking simultaneously.
    Version:
    1.3
    Author:
    Maftei Stefan - Radu

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Character character1
      First Character located in the maze
      private int[][] character1_map
      Map of first Character's path length in each cell (Lee algorithm)
      private Character character2
      Second Character located in the maze
      private int[][] character2_map
      Map of second Character's path length in each cell (Lee algorithm)
      private java.lang.String filename_in
      Input file's name
      private CityMap map
      Map which represents the maze like a matrix

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Game(java.lang.String name1, int code1, java.lang.String name2, int code2, java.lang.String filename_in)
      Initializes a Game with given Characters' names and codes, and input file's name

      Here the execution starts

      Plays in order to determine the shortest distance and write the solution to output file

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(java.lang.String name1,
            int code1,
            java.lang.String name2,
            int code2,
            java.lang.String filename_in)
        Initializes a Game with given Characters' names and codes, and input file's name
        Parameters:
        name1 - The name of the first Character
        code1 - The code of the first Character in the map matrix of the maze
        name2 - The name of the second Character
        code2 - The code of the second Character in the map matrix of the maze
        filename_in - Input file's name

    • Method Detail

      • isInMapBoundaries

        private boolean isInMapBoundaries(int x,
                                  int y)
        Verifies if a set of coordinates is in the map matrix boundaries
        Parameters:
        x - X Coordinate
        y - Y coordinate
        Returns:
        True if the set of coordinates is in the map matrix boundaries, otherwise false

      • getMinDistance

        public int getMinDistance(int[][] map_matrix,
                          Point startPoint,
                          Point finishPoint)
        Traverse the map matrix to find the shortest distance between Characters
        Parameters:
        map_matrix - Map matrix of the maze (after this function it will be the map matrix where every cell is numbered with the distance to starting point)
        startPoint - Point from where the path starts (a Character's Point)
        finishPoint - Point to where the path finishes (other Character's Point)
        Returns:
        The shortest distance between the Characters' Points

      • writeToFile

        public void writeToFile(int distance)
        Writes the solution to output file
        Parameters:
        distance - Shortest distance between the two Characters

      • play

        public void play()
        Plays in order to determine the shortest distance and write the solution to output file

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Here the execution starts
        Parameters:
        args - We don't use them
